translated: The Elder’s Birth Story🔽. The Chapter with Kiṅkaṇi Flowers
The Elder Tīṇi Kiṅkaṇi Flowers
Shining like a kaṇikāra flower,
sitting in the midst of the mountains;
I saw the dust-free Buddha,
Vipaśyin, the Leader of the World.
I picked three kiṅkaṇi flowers,
and placed them on his head;
having worshipped the Sambuddha,
I went off in a southerly direction.
By that good deed well done,
and by my intention and aspiration;
having given up my human body,
I went to the Tāvatiṃsa heaven.
For ninety-one eons,
I worshipped the Buddha;
I do not recall any bad destination,
this is the fruit of worshipping the Buddha.
My defilements are burnt up,
all my existences are destroyed;
like an elephant breaking its bonds,
I live without defilements.
How welcome it was for me
in the presence of the Buddha;
The three knowledges have been attained,
and the Buddha’s instruction has been fulfilled.
The four analytical knowledges,
and the eight liberations;
The six direct knowledges have been realized,
